verses.kjv: Then David said, This is the house of the LORD God, and this is the altar of the burnt offering for Israel.
verses.ct: Then David declared, "This is the house of the LORD God, and this is the altar of burnt offering for Israel."

verses.kjv: And David commanded to gather together the strangers that were in the land of Israel; and he set masons to hew wrought stones to build the house of God.
verses.ct: David ordered that the foreigners living in the land of Israel be gathered together, and he assigned stonecutters to shape blocks of stone for building the house of God.

verses.kjv: And David prepared iron in abundance for the nails for the doors of the gates, and for the joinings; and brass in abundance without weight;
verses.ct: David stockpiled huge quantities of iron for nails, door fittings, and joints, along with more bronze than could be weighed.

verses.kjv: Also cedar trees in abundance: for the Zidonians and they of Tyre brought much cedar wood to David.
verses.ct: He also gathered an enormous supply of cedar logs, because the people of Sidon and Tyre had brought vast amounts of cedar wood to David.

verses.kjv: And David said, Solomon my son is young and tender, and the house that is to be builded for the LORD must be exceeding magnifical, of fame and of glory throughout all countries: I will therefore now make preparation for it. So David prepared abundantly before his death.
verses.ct: David said, "My son Solomon is still young and inexperienced, and the house to be built for the LORD must be extraordinarily magnificent — famous and glorious throughout every nation. So I will begin making preparations for it now." David gathered materials in great abundance before his death.

verses.kjv: Then he called for Solomon his son, and charged him to build an house for the LORD God of Israel.
verses.ct: Then he summoned his son Solomon and instructed him to build a house for the LORD God of Israel.

verses.kjv: And David said to Solomon, My son, as for me, it was in my mind to build an house unto the name of the LORD my God:
verses.ct: David told Solomon, "My son, I had my heart set on building a house to honor the name of the LORD my God.

verses.kjv: But the word of the LORD came to me, saying, Thou hast shed blood abundantly, and hast made great wars: thou shalt not build an house unto my name, because thou hast shed much blood upon the earth in my sight.
verses.ct: But the word of the LORD came to me, saying, 'You have spilled too much blood and fought too many wars. You will not build a house for my name, because you have shed so much blood on the earth in my presence.

verses.kjv: Behold, a son shall be born to thee, who shall be a man of rest; and I will give him rest from all his enemies round about: for his name shall be Solomon, and I will give peace and quietness unto Israel in his days.
verses.ct: Pay attention — a son will be born to you who will be a man of peace. I will give him rest from all his enemies on every side. His name will be Solomon, and I will grant peace and calm to Israel during his lifetime.

verses.kjv: He shall build an house for my name; and he shall be my son, and I will be his father; and I will establish the throne of his kingdom over Israel for ever.
verses.ct: He is the one who will build a house for my name. He will be my son, and I will be his father, and I will secure the throne of his kingdom over Israel forever.'

verses.kjv: Now, my son, the LORD be with thee; and prosper thou, and build the house of the LORD thy God, as he hath said of thee.
verses.ct: Now, my son, may the LORD be with you. May you succeed and build the house of the LORD your God, just as he promised about you.

verses.kjv: Only the LORD give thee wisdom and understanding, and give thee charge concerning Israel, that thou mayest keep the law of the LORD thy God.
verses.ct: May the LORD give you wisdom and understanding, and may he give you authority over Israel so that you follow the law of the LORD your God.

verses.kjv: Then shalt thou prosper, if thou takest heed to fulfil the statutes and judgments which the LORD charged Moses with concerning Israel: be strong, and of good courage; dread not, nor be dismayed.
verses.ct: Then you will succeed, if you carefully obey the statutes and regulations that the LORD gave Moses for Israel. Be strong and courageous — don't be afraid and don't lose heart.

verses.kjv: Now, behold, in my trouble I have prepared for the house of the LORD an hundred thousand talents of gold, and a thousand thousand talents of silver; and of brass and iron without weight; for it is in abundance: timber also and stone have I prepared; and thou mayest add thereto.
verses.ct: Look, through great effort I have set aside for the house of the LORD 100,000 talents of gold, 1,000,000 talents of silver, and bronze and iron beyond measuring because there is so much of it. I have also prepared timber and stone, and you can add even more to it.

verses.kjv: Moreover there are workmen with thee in abundance, hewers and workers of stone and timber, and all manner of cunning men for every manner of work.
verses.ct: You also have an enormous workforce available to you — stonecutters, masons, carpenters, and every kind of skilled craftsman for every type of work.

verses.kjv: Of the gold, the silver, and the brass, and the iron, there is no number. Arise therefore, and be doing, and the LORD be with thee.
verses.ct: The gold, silver, bronze, and iron are beyond counting. Get up and get started, and may the LORD be with you."

verses.kjv: David also commanded all the princes of Israel to help Solomon his son, saying,
verses.ct: David also commanded all the leaders of Israel to support his son Solomon, saying,

verses.kjv: Is not the LORD your God with you? and hath he not given you rest on every side? for he hath given the inhabitants of the land into mine hand; and the land is subdued before the LORD, and before his people.
verses.ct: "Isn't the LORD your God with you? Hasn't he given you peace on every side? He has given me victory over the inhabitants of this land, and it has been brought under control before the LORD and before his people.

verses.kjv: Now set your heart and your soul to seek the LORD your God; arise therefore, and build ye the sanctuary of the LORD God, to bring the ark of the covenant of the LORD, and the holy vessels of God, into the house that is to be built to the name of the LORD.
verses.ct: Now commit yourselves completely — heart and soul — to seeking the LORD your God. Get up and build the sanctuary of the LORD God, so that the ark of the covenant of the LORD and the holy vessels of God can be brought into the house that will be built to honor the name of the LORD."
